text.content:
SIGNIFICANT ISSUES/SYMPTOMS/PROBLEMS: 

The patient indicates she is going a little better but still worries about what 
will happen when she is out on her own.  She is enjoying group therapy and feels 
it is helpful.  She looks forward to seeing her children today that will be here 
to visit.  She continues having suicidal thoughts, but they are less often and 
less intrusive.

Active Inpatient Medications (excluding Supplies):
 
     Active Inpatient Medications                           Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
5)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
7)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
9)   VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE

RELEVANT MENTAL STATUS AND OTHER OBJECTIVE FINDINGS:
 depressed mood,  blunted affect, less crying.

VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  120/70 (02/17/2013 08:35)
          Pulse:  67 (02/17/2013 08:35)
    Temperature:  98.3 F [36.8 C] (02/17/2013 08:35)
   Respirations:  14 (02/17/2013 08:35)
         Weight:  241 lb [109.5 kg] (11/20/2012 16:31)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  41
           Pain:  0 (02/17/2013 08:35)


ASSESSMENT:
Slowly improving.  Expect further improvement this week.  Pt has good social 
support with family.

PLAN:
Discontinue 1:1 sitter.  Continue group therapy.  Anticipate discharge end of 
the week.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,SEVEN
